1.verse: Paul, [the] apostle of Jesus Christ, by the will of God, by the promise of life [after the promise of life] that is in Christ Jesus,

2.verse: to Timothy, his most dear-worthy son, grace, mercy, and peace of God the Father, and of Jesus Christ, our Lord [and Jesus Christ, our Lord].

3.verse: I do thankings to my God, to whom I serve from my progenitors [from my progenitors, either ancestors,] in clean conscience, that without ceasing I have mind of thee in my prayers, night and day,

4.verse: desiring to see thee; having mind of thy tears [mindful of thy tears], that I be filled with joy.

5.verse: And I bethink of that faith [And I take recording, or mind, of that faith], that is in thee not feigned, which also dwelled first in thine aunt Lois, and in thy mother Eunice. And I am certain, that also in thee.

6.verse: For which cause I admonish thee, that thou raise again the grace of God, that is in thee by the setting on of mine hands [by the on-putting of mine hands].

7.verse: For why [Soothly] God gave not to us the spirit of dread, but of virtue, and of love, and of soberness.

8.verse: Therefore do not thou shame the witnessing of our Lord Jesus Christ, neither me, his prisoner; but travail thou together in the gospel by the virtue of God [after the virtue of God];

9.verse: that delivered us, and called with his holy calling, not after our works, but by his purpose and grace [that delivered us, and called with this holy calling, not after our works, but after his purpose and grace], that is given [to us] in Christ Jesus before worldly times;

10.verse: but now it is open by the lightening of our Saviour Jesus Christ, which destroyed death, and lightened life and uncorruption by the gospel. [now forsooth it is open by the lighting of our Saviour Jesus Christ, the which soothly destroyed death, forsooth lighted life and uncorruption by the gospel.]

11.verse: In which I am set a preacher and apostle, and master of heathen men.

12.verse: For which cause also I suffer these things; but I am not confounded. For I know to whom I have believed, and I am certain that he is mighty to keep that (which) is taken to my keeping into that day.

13.verse: Have thou the form of wholesome words [Have thou the form of whole words], which thou heardest of me in faith and love in Christ Jesus.

14.verse: Keep thou the good [thing] taken to thy keeping by the Holy Ghost [Keep thou a good deposit, or thing taken to thy keeping, by the Holy Ghost], that dwelleth in us.

15.verse: Thou knowest this, that all that be in Asia be turned away from me, of which is Phygellus and Hermogenes [of whom is Phygellus and Hermogenes].

16.verse: The Lord give mercy to the house of Onesiphorus, for oft he refreshed me, and shamed not my chain.

17.verse: But when he came to Rome, he sought me busily, and found [me].

18.verse: The Lord give to him to find mercy of God in that day. And how great things he ministered to me at Ephesus, thou knowest better.

1.verse: Therefore thou, my son, be comforted in grace that is in Christ Jesus.

2.verse: And what things thou hast heard of me by many witnesses, betake thou these to faithful men, which shall be able also to teach other men.

3.verse: Travail thou as a good knight of Christ Jesus. [Travail thou as a good knight of Jesus Christ.]

4.verse: No man holding knighthood to God, wrappeth himself [enwrappeth himself] with worldly needs, that he please to him, to whom he hath proved himself.

5.verse: For he that fighteth in a battle [For why and he that striveth in a battle], shall not be crowned, but he fight lawfully.

6.verse: It behooveth an earth-tiller to receive first of the fruits.

7.verse: Understand thou what things I say [Understand what things I say]. For the Lord shall give to thee understanding in all things.

8.verse: Be thou mindful that the Lord Jesus Christ of the seed of David hath risen again from death [from dead], after my gospel,

9.verse: in which I travail unto bonds, as working evil [as evil working], but the word of God is not bound.

10.verse: Therefore I suffer all things [Therefore I sustain all things] for the chosen, that also they get the health, that is in Christ Jesus, with heavenly glory.

11.verse: A true word [is this that I say], that if we be dead together [to the world], also we shall live together [in bliss];

12.verse: if we suffer, [and] we shall reign together [with Christ]; if we deny [him], [and] he shall deny us;

13.verse: if we believe not, he dwelleth faithful, he may not deny himself.

14.verse: Teach thou these things [Forsooth these things I admonish], witnessing before God. Do not thou strive in words; for to nothing it is profitable, but to the subverting of men that hear.

15.verse: Busily keep [Busily care, or keep,] to give thyself an approved, praiseable workman to God, without shame, rightly treating the word of truth.

16.verse: But eschew thou unholy and vain speeches, for why those profit much to unfaithfulness, [Forsooth shun thou unholy and vain speeches, soothly they profit much to unpiety,]

17.verse: and the word of them creepeth as a canker. Of whom Philetus is, and Hymenaeus,

18.verse: which felled down [the which fell down] from the truth, saying that the rising again is now done, and they subverted the faith of some men [and turned upside-down the faith of some men].

19.verse: But the firm foundament of God standeth, having this mark [having this mark, either signet], The Lord knoweth which be his, and, Each man that nameth the name of the Lord, departeth from wickedness [depart from wickedness].

20.verse: But in a great house be not only vessels of gold and of silver, but also of tree and of earth; and so some be into honour, and some into despite.

21.verse: Therefore, if any man cleanseth himself from these [Therefore if any man shall cleanse himself from these], he shall be a vessel hallowed into honour, and profitable to the Lord, ready to all good work [ready into all good work].

22.verse: And flee thou [the] desires of youth, but follow thou rightwiseness, faith, charity, peace, with them that inwardly call the Lord [that in-call the Lord] of a clean heart.

23.verse: And eschew thou foolish questions, and without knowing [Forsooth shun thou foolish questions, and without discipline], witting that those gender chidings.

24.verse: But it behooveth the servant of the Lord to chide not [to not chide]; but to be mild to all men, able to teach, patient,

25.verse: with temperance reproving them that against-stand the truth, that sometime God give to them repenting, that they know the truth [that sometime God give them penance to know the truth],

26.verse: and that they rise again from the snares of the devil, of whom they be held prisoners at his will [of whom they be holden captive at his will].

1.verse: But know thou this thing, that in the last days perilous times shall approach [shall nigh],

2.verse: and men shall be loving themselves, covetous, high of bearing, proud, blasphemers, not obedient to father and mother, unkind, cursed,

3.verse: without affection, without peace, false blamers, uncontinent, unmild, without benignity,

4.verse: traitors, over-thwart [froward], swollen with proud thoughts [blown], blind, lovers of lusts more than of God,

5.verse: having the likeness of piety, but denying the virtue of it. And eschew thou these men.

6.verse: Of these they be that pierce houses, and lead women captives [and lead little women captive] charged with sins, which be led with diverse desires,

7.verse: evermore learning, and never perfectly coming to the science of truth. [evermore learning, and never perfectly coming to the knowing of truth.]

8.verse: And as Jannes and Jambres against-stood Moses, so [and] these against-stand the truth, men corrupt in understanding [men corrupt in soul, or understanding], reproved about the faith.

9.verse: But further they shall not profit, for the unwisdom of them shall be known to all men, as [and] theirs was.

10.verse: But thou hast gotten my teaching [my doctrine], ordinance, purposing [purpose], faith, long abiding, love, patience,

11.verse: persecutions, passions, which were made to me at Antioch, at Iconium, at Lystra, what manner persecutions I suffered, and the Lord hath delivered me of all [and the Lord delivered me of all].

12.verse: And all men that will live faithfully in Christ Jesus [And all men that will live piously, or faithfully, in Christ Jesus], shall suffer persecution.

13.verse: But evil men and deceivers shall increase into worse, erring, and sending into error. [Forsooth evil men and deceivers shall profit into worse, erring themselves, and sending others into error.]

14.verse: But dwell thou in these things that thou hast learned, and that be betaken to thee, witting of whom thou hast learned;

15.verse: for thou hast known holy letters from thy youth, which be able to learn thee to health [and for thou hast known holy letters from thy youth, or childhood, the which may inform thee to health], by faith that is in Christ Jesus.

16.verse: For all scripture inspired of God is profitable to teach, to reprove, to chastise, [for] to learn in rightwiseness,

17.verse: that the man of God be perfect, learned to all good work [learned to all good works].

1.verse: I witness before God and Christ Jesus, that shall deem the quick and the dead, by the coming of him, and the kingdom of him,

2.verse: preach the word, be thou busy suitably without rest, reprove thou, beseech thou, blame thou in all patience and doctrine. [preach the word, be thou busy to opportune and inopportune, reprove, beseech, blame in all patience and doctrine.]

3.verse: For time shall be, when men shall not suffer wholesome teaching, but at their desires they shall gather together to themselves masters itching to the ears. [Forsooth time shall be, when men shall not sustain whole doctrine, but at their desires, they shall gather together to themselves masters itching, or pleasing, to the ears.]

4.verse: And truly they shall turn away the hearing from truth, but to fables they shall turn. [And truly they shall turn away their hearing from truth, but to fables they shall be turned together.]

5.verse: But wake thou, in all things travail thou, do the work of an evangelist, fulfill thy service [fulfill thy service, or office], be thou sober.

6.verse: For I am sacrificed now, and the time of my departing is nigh.

7.verse: I have striven a good strife, I have ended the course, I have kept the faith.

8.verse: In the tother time a crown of rightwiseness is kept to me, which the Lord, a just doomsman, shall yield to me in that day; and not only to me, but also to these that love his coming [but to them that love his coming].

9.verse: Hie thou to come to me soon.

10.verse: For Demas, loving this world, hath forsaken me [Forsooth Demas hath forsaken me, loving this world], and went to Thessalonica, Crescens into Galatia, Titus into Dalmatia;

11.verse: Luke alone is with me. Take thou Mark [Take Mark], and bring with thee; for he is profitable to me into service.

12.verse: Forsooth I sent Tychicus to Ephesus.

13.verse: The cloak [cloth] which I left at Troas at Carpas, when thou comest, bring with thee, and the books, but most the parchments.

14.verse: Alexander, the treasurer, showed to me much evil; the Lord shall yield to him after his works.

15.verse: Whom also thou eschew; for he against-stood full greatly our words.

16.verse: In my first defence no man helped me, but all forsook me; be it not areckoned to them. [In my first defence no man was to me, but all forsook me; be it not reckoned to them.]

17.verse: But the Lord helped me, and comforted me, that the preaching be filled by me, and that all folks hear, that I am delivered from the mouth of the lion. [Forsooth the Lord stood nigh to me, and comforted me, that the preaching be full-filled by me, and that all folks hear, and I am delivered from the mouth of the lion.]

18.verse: And the Lord delivered me from all evil work, and shall make me safe into his heavenly kingdom, to whom be glory into worlds of worlds. Amen.

19.verse: Greet well Prisca, and Aquila, and the house of Onesiphorus.

20.verse: Erastus left at Corinth [Forsooth Erastus dwelt at Corinth], and I left Trophimus sick at Miletum.

21.verse: Hie thou to come before winter. Eubulus, and Pudens, and Linus, and Claudia, and all brethren, greet thee well.

22.verse: Our Lord Jesus Christ be with thy spirit. The grace of God be with you. Amen.
